qas.question: What is the disadvantage of the ski-jump?

answers.text: the penalty it exacts on aircraft size, payload, and fuel load

qas.question: What cannot launch using a ski-jump due to their high loaded weight?
What do heavily laden aircraft sometimes require the assistance from?
Why is a ski-jump not included on mixed flight deck operations where helicopters are present?

answers.text: would eliminate one or more helicopter landing areas

qas.question: How is the Russian SU-33 able to launch from the carrier Admiral Kuznetsov?

answers.text: with a minimal armament and fuel load

plausible_answers.text: the penalty it exacts on aircraft size, payload, and fuel load

qas.question: How is the Russian SU-33 unable to launch from the carrier Admiral Kuznetsov?

context: The disadvantage of the ski-jump is <a0_0><b5_0>the penalty it exacts on aircraft size, payload, and fuel load<b5_0/><a0_0/> (and thus range); <a1_0><b6_0>heavily laden aircraft<b6_0/><a1_0/> can not launch using a ski-jump because their high loaded weight requires either a longer takeoff roll than is possible on a carrier deck, or assistance from <a2_0><b7_0>a catapult or JATO rocket<b7_0/><a2_0/>. For example, the Russian Su-33 is only able to launch from the carrier Admiral Kuznetsov <a4_0><b9_0>with a minimal armament and fuel load<b9_0/><a4_0/>. Another disadvantage is on mixed flight deck operations where helicopters are also present such as a US Landing Helicopter Dock or Landing Helicopter Assault amphibious assault ship a ski jump is not included as this <a3_0><b8_0>would eliminate one or more helicopter landing areas<b8_0/><a3_0/>, this flat deck limits the loading of Harriers but is somewhat mitigated by the longer rolling start provided by a long flight deck compared to many STOVL carriers.
